Auser can theoretically have any number of roles from Zero to all the roles in the

,~ — How could you easily determine the number of roles that enable users to
¢ create matters?

¢

You could view the create matter permission in the security dictionary to see which
roles contain that permission. Note that this only works for the base product, because
the security dictionary will not update based on any changes that a project team or
security administrator makes to the roles.

Question

,~ — Agiven user appears on the access control list for claim 234-22-147282,
ow but that user cannot view or edit the claim. How could this happen?

SSoopooD OOOO OD ooo

Gi

Answer [a

,~ — Agiven user appears on the access control list for claim 234-22-147282,
ra but that user cannot view or edit the claim. How could this happen?

The user probably lacks the system permission to view and/or edit claims. In order to
view or edit a claim, the user must have the system permission and appear on the
ACL.

ra the three types of access?

Own access, view access, edit access.

SS Oooo D OOOO ODD oo

Gi

Question

_~ — Iwo different claims that use the same security profile can have two
¢ completely different access control lists. Why?

¢
¢

SSoopooD OOOO OD ooo

Gi

Answer [a

_~ — Iwo different claims that use the same security profile can have two
¢ completely different access control lists. Why?

¢
¢

The security profile generates a list of users based on the criteria. The users who meet
the criteria vary from claim to claim. For example, if a profile says only the claim owner
and members of his group can view and edit the claim, then two claims will have
different access control lists if they are owned by users in different groups.
